description:
When two people die at the same time, they’re sent to a place that’s neither heaven nor hell—a lavish bar between worlds where the stakes are high and the rules are simple: if you win you live again, if you die… you’re gone for good.

Decim is the bartender charged with serving the souls who enter Quindecim. He may make a mean cocktail, but his true profession is to play the role of arbiter—a judge who determines whether or not a soul is worthy of reincarnation. To aid in his judgment, the bar’s patrons are forced to play simple games laced with sadistic twists designed to bring their true natures to light. To Decim, judgment has always been black and white—that is—until he meets a mysterious young woman whose fate seems impossible to decide. His indecision shakes the very foundation of the games and raises the biggest question of all: Who is fit to judge the dead?

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Gambling
tags.description: Centers around the act of gambling.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Ice Skating
tags.description: Centers around the sport of ice skating.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Bowling
tags.description: Centers around the sport of Bowling.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

node.description:
__Genres:__ Emo, Alternative Metal, Alternative Rock, Screamo, Metal core, Post/Hardcore, Loud Rock

__[Website](https://noisycell.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/noisycell_staff)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/noisycell_official/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChhajU3mFRcSX1HimGCHF-g/featured)__

__Introduction:__
NoisyCell (ノイジーセル) is a Japanese rock band. They are under the label Bop (2014-), and their office is also associated with Bop.

__Biography:__
The band formed in 2007 with the core members being Ryosuke and Ryo, the band was based on a copy band, originally focusing on uploading works on the net using vocaloids, etc, but when Kiyoshi joined, they started live activities in Tokyo. After Kiyoshi's retirement, various support members were involved, and Kiara and Tatsuya joined the band, becoming main members.

__Members:__
- [Ryosuke](https://anilist.co/staff/152597/Ryosuke) - vocalist, guitarist (2007-)
- [Ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/152595/Ryo) - guitarist, screams, programming (2007-)
- Kiara - bass guitarist (2016-)
- Tatsuya - drummer (2016-)

__Former Members:__
- Kiyoshi - drummer (2013-2016)
- Chiharu - bass guitarist (unknown)

(Source: [ja.wikipedia.org](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/NoisyCell))

__[Website](http://bradio.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/BRADIO_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bradio_official/)__

__Founded:__ 2010
__Genres:__ Funk-rock, disco, soul
__Origin:__ Japan

__Introduction:__
BRADIO is a Japanse funk-rock band under record label Warner Music Japan (2017-), while having previously been under D&S Records (2013-2014) and Hero Music Entertainment (2014-2017). Their name is an acronym for "__B__reak the __R__ule __A__nd __D__o __I__mage __O__n", meaning that they will break the rules of everyday life, while having a wonderful image all around, and with this they will make a good place. The band calls their fans for Funky Party People (FPP)

__Biography:__
In 2010, The Movie Archives' Takaaki Shingyoji and Yuki Tanabe formed BRADIO with Soichi Ohyama (ex-Gold End), Ryosuke Sakai (ex-Gold End), and Takahiro Kitazawa (ex-Awesome Dude). That same year in December, they released their first demo and played in their first live concert. In April 2012, they released their second demo. In June 2012, Takahiro left the band and they were left with the current line up.

They signed with D&S Records and released their first mini album, _Diamond Pops_, in October 2013. Bradio released their second mini-album, _Swipe Times_, in July 2014 under Hero Music Entertainment. Their first single "Otona Hit Parade/Step In Time" was released in November 2014. At the beginning of 2015, their single, "Flyers", was used as the opening theme song for the anime _[Death Parade](https://anilist.co/anime/20931/Death-Parade/)_.

On June 3, 2015, Bradio released their first full-length album, _Power of Life_. Their single "Hotel Alien", released on November 11, 2015, was used as the opening of the anime _[Peeping Life Season 1](https://anilist.co/anime/21347/Peeping-Life-TV-Season-1/)_.

Their first ballad single "Gift" was released on June 1, 2016. The single is used to expressed how to say thank you for all children to their mothers. The second track, "Bring it on", is used in the Square Enix game _Rungun-Cannonball_ for smartphones.

Their single "Back to the Funk" was released on November 11, 2016. Their second album, _Freedom_, was released on January 18, 2017.

Their first major single "La pa Paradise" was released on October 11, 2017. This single is the first major single after they moved to the Warner Music Japan label.

On January 15, 2018, Bradio announced on their website, that drummer Tanabe Yuki (田邊有希) will leave the band.

Bradio performed internationally for the first time at A-Kon 2018 in Fort Worth, Texas. They returned to the United States to perform at Otakon in Washington, D.C. on July 24, 2018.

__Members:__
- [Shingyouji Takaaki (真行寺貴秋)](https://anilist.co/staff/152594/Takaaki-Shingyouji) — lead-vocal (2010-)
- Ohyama Soichi (大山聡一) — guitar, vocals (2010–)
- Sakai Ryosuke (酒井亮輔) — bass, vocals (2010–)

__Former Members:__
- Kitazawa Takahiro (北澤雄大) — guitar (2010–2012)
- Tanabe Yuki (田邊有希) — drums, vocals (2010–2018)

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BRADIO)

A Mexican voice actress.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [light novel author](https://anilist.co/staff/250535/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/niuya) | [Weibo](https://www.weibo.com/niuya123)

Liang moved to Japan in 2007 in order to further her art studies, taking up professional drawing classes and graduating in 2011. She joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) right afterwards, becoming a key animator after one year of working for the company.

She has named [Toshiyuki Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/103724/) as one of her main influences.
